article.title: AV
article.paragraph: WiktionaryAVavAVand variants may refer to:TOC right
article.heading: Companies and organizations

list.listitem: Avaya, a company listed on the New York Stock Exchange with symbol "AV"
the IATA code for the airlineAvianca
Aston Villa F.C., an English football club
AV Akademikerverlag GmbH & Co. KG, an imprint of the German group VDM Publishing
Aviva, British insurance company, listed on the New York Stock Exchange as "AV" and on the London Stock Exchange as "AV."

article.heading: Entertainment

list.listitem: AV idol, a type of Japanese porn star
A.V. (film)''A.V.'' (film), a 2005 Hong Kong film directed byPang Ho-Cheung

article.heading: Military

list.listitem: AV, the designation for "seaplane tender" in the United States Navy's ship classification system
Aviation, a military acronym or shorter version
AeroVironment, Inc., makers of Unmanned Aircraft Vehicles and Unmanned Aircraft Systems for the military

article.heading: Places

list.listitem: Anguilla, FIPS 10-4 code and obsolete NATO digram
Antelope Valley, a valley in Southern California wherePronghornare said to have once lived
Province of Avellino, a province of Italy in the ISO 3166-2:IT code

article.heading: Science

list.listitem: Gold, in the field of numismatics - from the Latin spelling of Aurum, Avrvm
Annular velocity, in Fluid dynamics
Apparent viscosity, in Fluid dynamics
A V, anA-type main sequence star
Bavarian A V, an 1853 steam locomotive model

article.heading: Technology

list.listitem: Anti-virus, antivirus software
Audio and video connector, a cable between two devices
Aperture priority, Av (Aperture value) is a common abbreviation on a camera mode dial
Access violation, a common computer software error

article.heading: Voting

list.listitem: Alternative Vote, a ranking system
Approval voting, a non-ranking system
America Votes, an organisation

article.heading: Other uses

list.listitem: Authorised Versionof the Bible (also known as King James Version)
Avenue, seeRoad(Ave. is more frequent)
Av (month), a month in the Hebrew calendar
ISO 639-1code of theAvar language
